turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Sort of like losing a son and gaining an empath, isn't it?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Please, Beverly, this is hard enough.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: If you start tearing up I promise to beam you out. Level one medical emergency.  Theres no crying in Starfleet.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: When was he... created?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: About twenty-five years ago. They probably used a hair follicle or skin cell.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I think a skin cells the more likely of the two.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: It has the ability to consume organic material at the subatomic level. I can't overestimate the danger of Thalaron radiation, Jean Luc. A microscopic amount could kill every living thing on this ship in a matter of seconds.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Understood. Keep on it. I need to know what he has and how to neutralize any threat. Give me options.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Beverly, come in.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: You're working late.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Remember him?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: He was a bit proud as I recall.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: He was a damn fool. Selfish and ambitious. Very much in need of seasoning.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: He turned out all right.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I so wanted to believe Shinzon. But the Thalaron radiation can't be explained away. Whatever he's after, it's not peace.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Is he very much like you were?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Jean Luc, Whatever you were... Right now you're the man you've made yourself. He's someone else.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I wish I could believe that, Doctor.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Aside from slightly elevated adrenalin and serotonin levels, you're completely normal.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Can you describe it, Deanna?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: The more I studied his DNA the more confusing it got. Finally I could only come to one conclusion... Shinzon was created with temporal RNA sequencing. He was designed so that at a certain point his aging process could be accelerated to reach your age more quickly, so he could replace you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: But the Romulans abandoned the plan.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: As a result the temporal sequencing was never activated. Remember, he was supposed to replace you at nearly your current age. He was engineered to skip thirty years of life. But since the RNA sequencing was never activated, his cellular structure has started to break down. He's dying.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Dying?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How long does he have?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: I can't be sure but the rate of decay seems to be accelerating.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: But we do have one advantage.  He needs your blood to live. He might come after you first.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm counting on it... We've been ordered to head to sector 3274. Starfleet is diverting the fleet to meet us there.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: To seek out new life and new civilizations. Zephyr. Cochrans own words. When Charles Darwin set out on the H.M.S. Beagle, on his journey into the unknown... he sailed without a single musket.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: That was another time.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How far we've come. Let me know if you need anything.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: You can' t imagine them, Jean Luc. They're kids! All with advance degrees in xenobiology and out to conquer every disease in the quadrant.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Reminds me of a young doctor I used to know...

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: They're running me ragged. Nothing but question day and night... I love it! Come to dinner and 1'1 tell you all about it. There's a Bajoran band at the officer's mess.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Not tonight, I have work here.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Soon then.  Ill save the last dance for you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: So... To happy endings.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: To happy endings.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Sir.  I noticed an interesting confluence of emotion at the wedding. I am familiar with the human concept of tears through laughter and its inverse, laughter through tears, but I could not help wondering about the human capacity for expressing both pleasure and sadness simultaneously.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I understand why it would seem confusing. Certain human rituals... like weddings, birthdays or funerals evoke strong and very complex emotions. These rites carry great weight with us because they denote the passage of time.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: And you were particularly aware of this feeling because Commander Riker will be leaving to assume command of the Titan?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Will and Deanna joining the Titan. Dr. Crusher going to Starfleet Medical...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: And this makes you "sad"?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Well. I suppose it does a bit. I'm very happy for them, of course, but I'm going to miss them. The ship will seem... incomplete without them.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: That is because you have a familiarity with them. You can predict specific reactions and behavior and are comfortable in that knowledge.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes. And, frankly, I envy them as well. They've made important choices; they're going to have great challenges ahead of them. New worlds to conquer...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The choices I made have led me here as well. This is the only home I have ever known. I cannot foresee a reason for leaving.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You never know what's over the horizon, Data. Before too long you'll be offered a command of your own.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: If I were... I believe my memory engrams would sense the absence of your specific reactions and behavior. I would "miss you."

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Now, you make a toast.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: To new worlds...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: New worlds. Yes Data, brave new worlds...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The closest signature is two kilometers to the west... that direction, sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Thank you, Data.  Let's see what she can do.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The final signature is approx- imately 300 meters up that incline.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Mister Worf, accompany Data please.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: He is very observant.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I can see that.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Data!

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Sorry, sir.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Starfleet intelligence was only able to provide a partial account of his military record. We can infer he is relatively young and a capablecommander. He fought seventeen major engagements in the war. All successful. Beyond that, we know nothing.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Well... it seems we're truly sailing into the unknown. Keep at it. Anything you can give me would be appreciated. Dismissed.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Data to Captain Picard. Geordi and I have identified the source of the unauthorized computer access. And, I believe, we have also discovered an opportunity to gain a tactical advantage.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: On my way.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: My mission was a success, sir. I have discovered the source of the Thalaron radiation.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Good work. The download?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: He believes he has our communications protocols. But they will give him inaccurate locations for all Starfleet vessels.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A bit less florid, Data.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Aye, sir... This way.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A weapon.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: It would appear so.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Geordi equipped me with the prototype for the Emergency Transport Unit. I recommend you use it to return to the Enterprise.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It'll only work for one of us.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We'll find a way off together. Recommendations?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: There is a shuttlebay 948 meters from our current location.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Alacrity would be appreciated, Commander.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: They are trying to override the access codes. Reman is really a most complex language with pictographs representing certain verb roots and...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: While I find that fascinating, Data, we really need that Goddamned door open!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What do you imagine this is?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Port thrusters, sir. Would you like me to drive?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Can you open the shuttlebay doors?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Affirmative, sir. Negative, sir. They have instigated security overrides and erected a force field around the external portals.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Well then... only one way to go.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Do you think this is a wise course of action?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We're about to find out... Power up disruptors and fire on my mark.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Ready, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Fire!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How long until we reach the fleet?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: At our current velocity we will arrive at sector 3274 in approximately 40 minutes.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: "For now we see but through a glass darkly..." He said he's a mirror.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Of you?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I do not agree. Although you share the same genetic structure, the events of your life have created unique individual.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: But so much is the same. On a biological level he is... and I will not accept the idea that there is nothing I can do. I have a responsibility to try to make a human connection with him.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: He would deny a "human" connection is possible. He considers himself entirely Reman.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: He may have already rejected my humanity, but you also have a twin

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No, sir, it is not possible. The B-9 is physically identical to me, although his neural pathways are not as advanced. But even if they were, he would not be me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How can you be sure?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I aspire, sir. To be better than I am. The B-9 does not. Nor does Shinzon.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: We are passing through the Bassen Rift. The projections will return when we have cleared it.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It's interfering with our uplink from Starfleet cartography?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Yes, sir. The Rift effects all long-range communications.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Commander Riker, evasive maneuvers!

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: We are losing dorsal shields.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Full axis rotation to port! Fire all ventral phasers!

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Captain, we have lost ventral shielding on deck twenty nine.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Divert power and compensate.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: We are being hailed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Deanna, stand by.  Open a channel.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Sir, allow me to go. You are needed here.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Negative.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Sir.

turns.speaker: HEAD
turns.text: Why am I looking at me?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: You are not looking at your- self. You are looking at me.

turns.speaker: HEAD
turns.text: You do not look like me.

turns.speaker: HEAD
turns.text: You have a red shirt.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: This is not an appropriate time for a conversation.

turns.speaker: HEAD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Because the captain has to concentrate on piloting the vehicle.

turns.speaker: HEAD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Since positronic signatures have only been known to emanate from androids such as myself, it is logical to theorize that there is an android such as myself on Kolarus III.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: How many of you did Dr. Soong make?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I thought only me, myself and Lore.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Isolated pockets of humanoids. It appears to be a pre-warp civilization at an early stage of industrial development.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Captain, I don't recommend transporting, that ion storm doesn't look very neighborly. -It could head this way with- out much warning .

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Well, he seems to have the same internal mechanics as Data but not as much positronic develop- ment.  The neural pathways aren't nearly as sophisticated. Id say he's a prototype. Something Dr. Soong created before Data .

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Do you have a name, sir?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: At present he serves no useful function. Dr. Soong created us to become active and useful members of society. I do not believe he would have wanted the B-9 to live out his life in his present state.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: I can't believe the Captain went along with a memory download.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Captain Picard agrees that the B-9 was probably designed with the same self-actualization parameters as myself. If my memory engrams are successfully integrated into his positronic matrix, he should have all my abilities.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: He'd have all your memories too. You feel comfortable with that?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I feel nothing, Geordi. It is my belief that with my memory engrams he will be able to function as a more complete individual.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: An individual more like you, you mean.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Maybe he's not supposed to be like you. Maybe he's supposed to be just like he is.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: What purpose does this serve?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: It seems to be a redundant memory port.  Maybe it's for provisional memory storage in case his neural pathways overload?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Dr. Soong must have found it unnecessary in later versions.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: It's possible the extra memory port is interfering with the engram processing. Mind if I keep him here and run some diagnostics?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No, I do not mind.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: But I believe he will prove incapable of performing higher functions.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Don't give up hope, Data. I know, I know, you're not capable of hope.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I am not.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: We have lost structural integrity on decks twelve through seventeen, sections four through ten.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Emergency force fields are holding.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: What is our approximate distance?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: It appears to be...  ... an arm.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Why is it moving?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Like me, it has been designed with modular power sources.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: It's you.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The resemblance is... striking.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I would like to pick you up now. May I do that?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: If you wouldn't mind.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: Really, Captain, it was a lovely toast.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The least I could do for you, Deanna.  Besides, you know me... Im a talking head.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: And you needn't worry. I'll brief your new counselor on everything she needs to know.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The hell you will. You know too much about me as it is ... Now you promised there are no speeches during the ceremony on Betazed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: May I have this dance?

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: With pleasure, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Counselor.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: Do you have a moment, sir?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Of course, sit down.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: It's about Data  I've watched him with the B-9 and I'm troubled. Data's desire for a "family" is very strong. I'm afraid he may be investing too much in the B-9.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You're speaking of emotional investment?

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: The B-9 is like a slow child, sir. And Data, in his own way, has assumed the position of a parent or guardian. I'm afraid he has expectations based on his own experiences. He'll be disappointed when the BI-9 cannot meet those expectations.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: As much as we care for him, Deanna... we have to remember that Data isn't capable of disappointment.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: I don't believe that, sir. Weve shared many disappointing journeys.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm going to miss you.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: And I you.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: I would say he's been trained to resist telepathy. What I could sense of his emotions were erratic, very hard to follow.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Is he sincere about wanting peace?

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: Sir, the strongest sense I had was that he's more than urious about you. He very much wants to know you.  The same way you want to know him.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How could I not?

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: Captain, don't assume he's anything like you are. You should resist the urge to think you know him.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I not only know him, Deanna, I am him.. and he is me!

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: Shinzon's Viceroy seems to have the ability to reach into my thoughts. I've become a liability... I request to be relieved of my duties.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Permission denied. If you can possibly endure any more of these assaults.  I need you at my side. Now more than ever I...

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: How can you be certain?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I know how he thinks.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: Captain -- I might have a way to find them.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Counselor?

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: The one thing he may have forgotten in the course of battle: me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Make it so.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: But how can he? He'll kill you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: This isn't about me anymore.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: I'm only half human.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Deanna Troi of Betazed. Empathic and telepathic abilities, ship's counselor. All of this I knew... But I didn't know you were so beautiful.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Imzadi. This is so good.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: He can never know you as I know you... He can never touch you as I touch you.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: This isn't real.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Can you feel my hands... are they real? Can you feel my lips, my loins?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I'll always be with you now. Now and forever.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: You sick bastard!

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: You're not here.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Very logical, Deanna... But your heart doesn't constrain itself to mere logic.  To leave all of this behind and be with me.

turns.speaker: DEANNA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I can feel your desire, Deanna.

turns.speaker: DONATRA
turns.text: Captain Picard, Commander Donatra of the Warbird Valdore. Might we be of assistance?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Your timing is impeccable, Commander.

turns.speaker: DONATRA
turns.text: The Empire considers this a matter of internal security. We regret you've become involved.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: When this is over, I owe you a drink.

turns.speaker: DONATRA
turns.text: I'm afraid that drink will have to wait, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Do you have life support?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Understood.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Open a channel.

turns.speaker: DONATRA
turns.text: This is Commander Donatra of the Valdore. We're dispatching shuttles with medical personnel and supplies.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Thank you, Commander.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: It's very faint but I've isolated it to the third planet in the Kolarin system.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What do we know about the planet?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Uncharted. We'll have to get closer for a more detailed scan.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Theories?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: I read six distinct positronic signatures, spread out over a few kilometers on the surface.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What do we know about the population?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Cannon fodder.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Then how did a Reman get to be Praetor? I don't get it.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: It's going to take some time to find out -- the data stream was rerouted through substations all over the ship.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What programs were accessed?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: That's what I don't get -- it's mostly basic stellar cartography: star charts; communications protocols; some uplinks from colony tracking stations. It's not even restricted material.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Set up a security program to detect any unusual data stream rerouting. If it happens again, we want to be ready.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: There's something else. I was reviewing the sensor logs.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I thought Thalaron radiation was theoretical.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Which is why our initial scans didn't pick it up. But he's got it, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: As I remember, Thalaron research was banned in the Federation because of its bioqenic properties.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: It's called a Cascading Bio- genic Pulse. The unique properties of Thalaron radiation allow the energy beam to expand almost without limits. Depending on the radiant intensity it could encompass a ship... or a planet.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: And that's exactly what he's going to do.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: He's getting his cloak back. We have exhausted our compliment of photon torpedoes. Phaser banks are down to four percent.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What if we target all phasers in a concentrated attack?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: What's he doing?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: He wants to look me in the eye.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: He thinks he knows exactly what I'm going to do.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Weve got him!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Geordi, put 211 power to the engines.  Take it from life support if you have to -- everything you can give me.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Deanna, on my mark.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Ready, sir!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How long until he can fire?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: The targeting sequence should take about four minutes.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Prepare for a site-to-site transport.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Sir, we wont be able to bring you back. Its a one way trip. Captain, I don't know if the transporter...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: That's an order, Commander.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You have the bridge, Commander. Use all available power to move away from the Scimitar.  Now, Mister La Forge.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Sir, we're being hailed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Geordi... prepare the shuttle- bay for arrivals. They don't know our procedures so just... open the doors.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: I'll take care of it, sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Number One.  You have the bridge.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Admiral Janeway. Good to see you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: With or without the rest of the fleet?

turns.speaker: JANEWAY
turns.text: A diplomatic mission. We've been invited, believe it or not. Seems there's been some kind of internal political shakeup. The new Praetor, someone called Shinzon, has requested a Federation envoy.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: New Praetor?

turns.speaker: JANEWAY
turns.text: There's more... as always. He's Reman.

turns.speaker: JANEWAY
turns.text: Believe me, we don't under- stand it either. You're the closest ship so I want you to high tail it over there and hear what he has to say. Get the lay of the land, If the Empire becomes unstable, it could mean trouble for the entire quadrant.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Understood.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Not with the Romulans.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Just lucky, Admiral.

turns.speaker: JANEWAY
turns.text: Let's hope that luck holds. Janeway out.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: Enterprise. We are the Reman Warbird Scimitar.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Praetor Shinzon, I'm pleased to...

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: I am not Shinzon. I am his Viceroy. We are sending transport coordinates.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: So, human... you've met your better self!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What are you doing to Counsellor Troi?

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: I'm preparing her for Shinzon. To sooth him as she soothes you. To stand at his side as she does at yours.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: That will never happen.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: Listen to him, android. Such a small and weak creature. Yet he roars so valiantly...

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: It would take me but an instant to tear that valiant heart from your chest.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There'll be another after me. And another after that. You'll find we're a resilient species.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: I look forward to the sport.  Take him.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: I won't do it.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Wont do what, Mister Worf?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Captain. I think it is inappropriate for a Starfleet officer to appear...  Naked.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Come now, a big, strapping fellow like you? What are you afraid of?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: I'm picking up an unusual electromagnetic signature from the Kolarin system.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What sort of signature?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: To find the head, sir?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If you don't mind.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Sir, I recommend we raise shields.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Not yet, Mister Worf.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Captain!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Tactical analysis, Mister Worf.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Fifty-two disruptor banks, twenty-seven photon torpedo bays, primary and secondary phased shields.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: We're being hailed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Sir, we've had an unauthorized access into the main computer.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Who was it?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Worf, prepare a full phaser spread, zero elevation. All banks on my mark. Scan for shield impacts and stand by photon torpedoes.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Aye, sir
